TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PopupWindow extends Java.Lang.Object

remarks.para:
A popup window that can be used to display an arbitrary view. The popup window is a floating container that appears on top of the current activity.
See Also

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: Create a new empty, non focusable popup window of dimension (0,0).
The popup does not provide any background. This should be handled by the content view.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int AnimationStyle { get; set; }
.property instance int32 AnimationStyle

remarks.para: Return the animation style to use the popup appears and disappears
Change the animation style resource for this popup.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to one of the methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable Background { get; }

Docs.summary: Return the drawable used as the popup window's background.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ClippingEnabled { get; set; }
.property instance bool ClippingEnabled

remarks.para: Indicates whether clipping of the popup window is enabled.
Allows the popup window to extend beyond the bounds of the screen. By default the window is clipped to the screen boundaries. Setting this to false will allow windows to be accurately positioned.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to one of the methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Views.View ContentView { get; set; }
.property instance class Android.Views.View ContentView

remarks.para: Return the view used as the content of the popup window.
Change the popup's content. The content is represented by an instance of .
This method has no effect if called when the popup is showing.

remarks.para: Dispose of the popup window. This method can be invoked only after has been executed. Failing that, calling this method will have no effect.

.event class System.EventHandler DismissEvent
public virtual float Elevation { get; set; }
.property instance float32 Elevation
public virtual bool Focusable { get; set; }
.property instance bool Focusable

remarks.para: Indicate whether the popup window can grab the focus.

Changes the focusability of the popup window. When focusable, the window will grab the focus from the current focused widget if the popup contains a focusable . By default a popup window is not focusable.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to one of the methods.

Docs.param: The view on which the popup window must be anchored.
Docs.summary: Returns the maximum height that is available for the popup to be completely shown.

remarks.para: Returns the maximum height that is available for the popup to be completely shown. It is recommended that this height be the maximum for the popup's height, otherwise it is possible that the popup will be clipped.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsAboveAnchor { get; }
.property instance bool IsAboveAnchor

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the popup is showing above (the y coordinate of the popup's bottom is less than the y coordinate of the anchor) or below the anchor view (the y coordinate of the popup is greater than y coordinate of the anchor's bottom).

remarks.para:
Indicates whether the popup is showing above (the y coordinate of the popup's bottom is less than the y coordinate of the anchor) or below the anchor view (the y coordinate of the popup is greater than y coordinate of the anchor's bottom).
The value returned by this method is meaningful only after or was invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsShowing { get; }
.property instance bool IsShowing

remarks.para: Indicate whether this popup window is showing on screen.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OutsideTouchable { get; set; }
.property instance bool OutsideTouchable

remarks.para: Indicates whether the popup window will be informed of touch events outside of its window.

Controls whether the pop-up will be informed of touch events outside of its window. This only makes sense for pop-ups that are touchable but not focusable, which means touches outside of the window will be delivered to the window behind. The default is false.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to one of the methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetWindowLayoutMode (int widthSpec, int heightSpec);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetWindowLayoutMode(int32 widthSpec, int32 heightSpec) cil managed

Docs.param: an explicit width measure spec mode, either , , or 0 to use the absolute width.
an explicit height measure spec mode, either , , or 0 to use the absolute height.

remarks.para: Change the width and height measure specs that are given to the window manager by the popup. By default these are 0, meaning that the current width or height is requested as an explicit size from the window manager. You can supply or to have that measure spec supplied instead, replacing the absolute width and height that has been set in the popup.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ShowAsDropDown (Android.Views.View anchor);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowAsDropDown(class Android.Views.View anchor) cil managed

Docs.param: the view on which to pin the popup window

remarks.para: Display the content view in a popup window anchored to the bottom-left corner of the anchor view. If there is not enough room on screen to show the popup in its entirety, this method tries to find a parent scroll view to scroll. If no parent scroll view can be scrolled, the bottom-left corner of the popup is pinned at the top left corner of the anchor view.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ShowAsDropDown (Android.Views.View anchor, int xoff, int yoff);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowAsDropDown(class Android.Views.View anchor, int32 xoff, int32 yoff) cil managed

Docs.param: the view on which to pin the popup window
A horizontal offset from the anchor in pixels
A vertical offset from the anchor in pixels

remarks.para: Display the content view in a popup window anchored to the bottom-left corner of the anchor view offset by the specified x and y coordinates. If there is not enough room on screen to show the popup in its entirety, this method tries to find a parent scroll view to scroll. If no parent scroll view can be scrolled, the bottom-left corner of the popup is pinned at the top left corner of the anchor view.
If the view later scrolls to move anchor to a different location, the popup will be moved correspondingly.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ShowAsDropDown (Android.Views.View anchor, int xoff, int yoff, Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity);

A horizontal offset from the anchor in pixels
A vertical offset from the anchor in pixels
Alignment of the popup relative to the anchor

remarks.para: Display the content view in a popup window anchored to the bottom-left corner of the anchor view offset by the specified x and y coordinates. If there is not enough room on screen to show the popup in its entirety, this method tries to find a parent scroll view to scroll. If no parent scroll view can be scrolled, the bottom-left corner of the popup is pinned at the top left corner of the anchor view.
If the view later scrolls to move anchor to a different location, the popup will be moved correspondingly.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ShowAtLocation (Android.Views.View parent, Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, int x, int y);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowAtLocation(class Android.Views.View parent, valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, int32 x, int32 y) cil managed

Docs.param: a parent view to get the token from
the gravity which controls the placement of the popup window

remarks.para: Display the content view in a popup window at the specified location. If the popup window cannot fit on screen, it will be clipped. See for more information on how gravity and the x and y parameters are related. Specifying a gravity of is similar to specifying Gravity.LEFT | Gravity.TOP.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SplitTouchEnabled { get; set; }
.property instance bool SplitTouchEnabled

remarks.para: Indicates whether the popup window supports splitting touches.

Allows the popup window to split touches across other windows that also support split touch. When this flag is false, the first pointer that goes down determines the window to which all subsequent touches go until all pointers go up. When this flag is true, each pointer (not necessarily the first) that goes down determines the window to which all subsequent touches of that pointer will go until that pointer goes up thereby enabling touches with multiple pointers to be split across multiple windows.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Touchable { get; set; }
.property instance bool Touchable

remarks.para: Indicates whether the popup window receives touch events.
Changes the touchability of the popup window. When touchable, the window will receive touch events, otherwise touch events will go to the window below it. By default the window is touchable.
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to one of the methods.
